intro: Sphaerostephanos lucbanii, commonly known as the Lucban star-fruit, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is known for its small, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species.
